title.narrative: PDAO Value Chain Development in Takeo

description.narrative:
Rachana and PDAO have jointly developed project with supporting from Oxfam on Women in Chicken and Vegatable Value Chain in Takoe province. The project aim to the standard of living - physical and economic environment - in selected poor villages is improved and women in particular are empowered to participate in agri-business. Objective 1: To develop community understanding of an effective business model of smallholder farmer/producers and agriculture cooperatives, particularly women, improving organic farming skills and diversifying the farm production base to greater utilise their available resources. Expected Results:
1.1 The existing saving for change groups, self-help groups, and agriculture cooperatives are empowered and encouraged to be producer farmers within the target community; 1.2 60% of local famers/producers and existing saving for change groups agriculture cooperative (ACs)# members have a deepunderstanding of production cycle and scheduling, and know how to produce quality safe products through the application of organic principles, production planning and management.
Objective 2: To maximize income of smallholder farmers# producers in vegetable and chicken, through promoting better access to markets and developing an agri-business model, creating partnerships between farmer producers and/or agriculture cooperative and existing organic and super markets. Expected Results: 2.1 Qualified agricultural products including vegetables and chicken have accessed to the existing markets, especially premium organic markets and super markets in PhnomPenh; 2.2 Lessons learned, experiences, successes/failures, and new initiatives relating to the new business model are well-documented in Khmer langue and shared with other relevant stakeholders, especially farmers; Intervention Strategy: - Community empowerment and mobilization- working with existing producer group can be self-help group/sfc group to fucntion their role and influencing. - Capacity building- the technical capacity building will be provided mainly agricultural production includes demonstration, exchange visit. - Enabling and promote to access to market: ACs will play role on market negotiation to maximize the products price and minimixe agriculture inputs. - Added value:SfC will used as capital added to AC to improve their business opportunities.

participating-org.narrative: PDAO is a local, non-profit non-Governmental aid organization that through financial and technical support from HEKS Swiss Interchurch Aid Cambodia commenced independent operation in July 2005. At that time HEKS handed over the operation and management of all of its Cambodia programs that started in 1996, and were operated in Takeo and Kampot provinces. PDAO was officially registered by the Ministry of Interior of the Kingdom of Cambodia in October 2005. The organization has a solid foundation with an active Board of Directors that consists of seven members, and a clear Vision and Mission, Goals and Values. In addition, it received the Certification with the Code of Ethical Principles and Minimum Standards for NGOs in Cambodia # NGO Governance and Professional Practice (NGO-GPP) #in 2010, expired in 2013. The organisation is planning to apply for the GPP again this year. PDAO#s current strategic plan is a 5 years plan to the end of 2018. Over the past seven years PDAO has received an average budget of around US$165,000 per annum. PDAO hasa history of success in supporting participatory community development. PDAO#s programs are aimed at providing local socio-economicdevelopment, food security improvement, and developing good governance at the local community level by empowering women and the poor to participate actively in local and provincial government processes. PDAO has been working with communities in two provinces (Takeo and Kampot) since 2005 and has recently expanded services to six other provinces around Tonle Sap in March 2011 (Kg. Thom, Siem Reap, Banteay Meanchey, Battambang, Pursat, and Kg. Chhnang) under a consultancy contract with the Ministry of Rural Development / Asian Development Bank grants which will operate until May 2015. PDAOgoal and purposes are to ensure the socioeconomic improvement forCambodian people living in rural areas by enhancing agricultural development, education about health and nutrition and increasing the alternative sources of family income. PDAO has three key focus areas: (1) Environment / agricultural production and mitigation ofclimate change; (2) Socio-economic and livelihood improvement (self-help groups, savings groups and farmer associations); (3) Localgovernance. In all activities human rights and gender equity are promoted.
